thread.title: West Indies native Petrina Easton displays art in Lake Worth show
thread.title_full: West Indies native Petrina Easton displays art in Lake Worth show | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: palmbeachpost
title: West Indies native Petrina Easton displays art in Lake Worth show
text:
The next solo exhibition at The Cultural Council of Palm Beach County will be dedicated to a woman born and raised in Trinidad & Tobago, West Indies.
She grew up among the multicultural, creative influences on the island, with its many traditions and beliefs.
“Adam and Eve” Petrina Easton, who now lives in Boynton Beach, is inspired by the merging social and cultural factors affecting modern life. Her current body of work is focused on still-life, taking a traditional approach but with a modern-day twist.
That mixed-media art — using acrylics, wood, photography and graphic design — will be on display in the downtown Lake Worth gallery through Nov. 7.
The opening reception is Saturday from 3 to 5 p.m.
“Cherry Pitter” “Fruit Medley”
IF YOU GO
Petrina Easton Solo Exhibition
When: Tuesday through Saturday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Where: Cultural Council of Palm Beach County, 601 Lake Ave., Lake Worth
Cost: Free. Info: 561-471-2901; www.palmbeachculture.com
</p
